resources.string: MITDigital Technologies
Click Here to "Digital Brochure Started"
Digital technologies

Our programmes have been developed after working with schools, businesses and the community to include all the components to ensure your success in this field. Our strong industry relationships mean you keep up with the latest advances and techniques that are in demand in the real world.

Our certificate and diploma qualifications will provide you with general IT skills. Our bachelor and graduate diplomas will further develop your interests and experience into a more specific area. Our postgraduate and masters programmes in applied technologies will take you to the next step in your IT career.
Get support from day one
When you join the MIT family you will be supported to learn the skills you need to get the job you want.
Hands-on skills
At MIT, you will apply classroom learning to real-world situations and graduate with the hands-on skills that are in demand.
Get job security
We work closely with industry and employers to ensure what we teach is what is needed in today’s changing market.
MIT degree graduates earn more**

Recently analysed Government data shows that MIT degree holders have the highest employment rates in the country five years after finishing their degrees. They can also expect to be among the best paid.**
Get free* study at MIT
If you are a domestic student your study could be free*. Explore your free study options *You may be eligible for free study, conditions apply. For more information visit: manukau.ac.nz/free-study
New Zealand Certificate in Digital Media and Design

Want to create digital content but don’t know where to start? Learn about photo, video, audio and digital image manipulation and how they combine to create engaging content over a range of digital platforms and social media.
New Zealand Certificate in Information Technology Essentials

More qualified graduates are needed to fill well-paid roles in IT. This qualification will provide you with key skills in digital technologies, including: Computer hardware,Operating systems and applications (apps)Software development, Web development
New Zealand Diploma in Information Technology Technical Support

Future-proof your career with skills in IT. You will learn what it takes to help businesses navigate the ever-changing IT landscape. Learn how to solve common technical support issues and develop service management and customer service skills.
New Zealand Diploma in Systems Administration

Want to help get New Zealand moving again? Graduates with the skills to secure IT systems are critical to the economy. Learn how to manage and secure databases and networks, and get the skills to find and fix problems.
Bachelor of Digital Technologies

Are you a natural problem solver? Do you keep up to date with the latest technology trends? Get training in key IT skills and graduate with a degree in high demand by the industry worldwide. This degree meets the accreditation standards of the Institute of IT Professionals (IITP), who say it’s “the best pathway to industry in New Zealand and abroad”.
Graduate Diplomas

Do you already have a degree and are looking to take your next step in the IT industry? Study with MIT to learn practical skills in IT in just one year. This programme is suitable for graduates from a variety of fields or those with relevant practical experience who want high-level academic training specific to IT.
Postgraduate Certificate in Applied Technologies

Are you looking to take the next-step in your IT career? Or want to enhance your IT knowledge and qualifications before you start working? Upskill with our digital technologies postgraduate certificate in just 16 weeks. You will gain specialist skills and knowledge so you can go confidently into the workforce or expand on your existing industry experience
1. CHECK THAT YOU MEET THE ENTRY REQUIREMENTS

Once you have decided on your programme, you will need to provide proof that you meet the entry requirements. Each programme has its own entry criteria based on academic achievements, qualications and/or work experience. Make your experience count At MIT we are proud to oer pathways that value your work, education and professional experience. What you already know and do can count towards a qualication with RPL (Recognition of Prior Learning). Contact us to nd out more. Fees may apply
2. APPLY TO STUDY

Domestic students 5. NEED HELP? Apply at manukau.ac.nz Or contact us for more information or help with your application. International students Visit manukau.ac.nz Go to the international students section of our website for more information on applications and supporting documentation. To apply you will need to contact our international team. international.application@manukau.ac.nz
3. ACCEPT AND ENROL

If your application to study is successful you will be emailed an er. You are required to accept this er online in order to be enrolled. This o er might be conditional on you meeting certain requirements.
4. PAY YOUR FEES

Some of our programmes have free fees. If you’re not eligible for free fees please ensure your fees are paid before your programme starts. Fees may be paid by: • direct credit (online banking or at your local branch) • applying for a student loan. Financial assistance You may be eligible for nancial assistance while you study. For information on student loans and allowances, contact Studylink. studylink.govt.nz
5. NEED HELP?

Domestic students If you have any queries contact our AskMe! team. 0800 62 62 52 enquiries@manukau.ac.nz We are open: Monday to Friday 7am-8pm (MIT Manukau and MIT Otara) Saturday 8.30am-4.30pm (MIT Manukau) Excludes public holidays

“I chose to study at MIT after meeting the lecturers who I felt could help me get the right start in my career. It was a great choice. During my studies I gained expert knowledge, tools and valuable industry experience through an internship. Everyone I graduated with got jobs quickly as there are so many opportunities with ICT in New Zealand and overseas."
For fees and free* study eligibility visit manukau.ac.nz
3 intake per Year
19 weeks (full-time)
Digtal tech student
New Zealand Certificate in Digital Media and Design
Careers
Assistant and/or support roles in various industries including advertising, web design, in-house design studio, news media.
